tidyusafec 0.1.0

    • Search Functions

    Search Functions

    Stephen Holzman

    2018-05-18

    search-functions.Rmd

    The tidyusafec workflow typically starts by searching for some group of candidates, committees, or elections using one of the search functions.

    • search_candidates() by default currently returns a tibble with information about candidates and their committees (one row for each unique pair)
    • search_elections() by default currently returns a tibble with information about elections, including the incumbent candidate if applicable.

    These functions send queries to the OpenFEC API, so you also need to register for a key.

    Setup Libraries and API Keys

    library(tidyverse)
#> ── Attaching packages ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.2.1 ──
#> ✔ ggplot2 2.2.1.9000     ✔ purrr   0.2.4     
#> ✔ tibble  1.4.2          ✔ dplyr   0.7.4     
#> ✔ tidyr   0.8.0          ✔ stringr 1.3.1     
#> ✔ readr   1.1.1          ✔ forcats 0.3.0
#> ── Conflicts ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
#> ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
#> ✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
library(tidyusafec)

#save_datagov_apikey(key = "DATA.GOV KEY STRING")

    search_candidates()

    A variety of search criteria are supported. Perhaps you want to find all candidates in a particular race, the committee ids of a candidate by their name, all candidates of a party in a particular state, or some other combination. Some examples are below and documentation for each argument can be accessed in RStudio using ?search_candidates.

    Search for Candidates Currently in a Particular Race

    va_10_house_candidates <- search_candidates(election_year = 2018, office = "H", state = "VA", district = "10", candidate_status = "C")
#> Candidates found: 11
#> Total Principal Committees associated with these candidates: 11

head(va_10_house_candidates)
#> # A tibble: 6 x 31
#>   .        load_date      last_file_date candidate_id election_years party
#>   <list>   <chr>          <chr>          <chr>        <list>         <chr>
#> 1 <list [… 2017-10-16T21… 2017-07-07     H8VA10148    <list [1]>     DEM  
#> 2 <list [… 2018-02-08T21… 2017-10-13     H8VA10163    <list [1]>     DEM  
#> 3 <list [… 2017-03-10T21… 2017-03-10     H4VA10089    <list [3]>     REP  
#> 4 <list [… 2017-09-27T20… 2017-06-07     H8VA10122    <list [1]>     DEM  
#> 5 <list [… 2017-09-27T20… 2017-05-11     H8VA10114    <list [1]>     DEM  
#> 6 <list [… 2018-03-12T21… 2018-03-11     H8VA10080    <list [1]>     DEM  
#> # ... with 25 more variables: candidate_status <chr>, office_full <chr>,
#> #   state <chr>, federal_funds_flag <lgl>, has_raised_funds <lgl>,
#> #   office <chr>, election_districts <list>, name <chr>,
#> #   district_number <int>, cycles <list>, incumbent_challenge <chr>,
#> #   party_full <chr>, first_file_date <chr>, active_through <int>,
#> #   incumbent_challenge_full <chr>, last_f2_date <chr>, district <chr>,
#> #   principal_committees <list>, committee_id <chr>, committee_name <chr>,
#> #   treasurer_name <chr>, earliest_cycle <int>, latest_cycle <int>,
#> #   earliest_election_year <int>, latest_election_year <int>

    Search For Candidate by Name

    obamas <- search_candidates(name = "Obama")
#> Candidates found: 5
#> Total Principal Committees associated with these candidates: 4

head(obamas)
#> # A tibble: 6 x 30
#>   load_date last_file_date candidate_id party candidate_status office_full
#>   <chr>     <chr>          <chr>        <chr> <chr>            <chr>      
#> 1 2016-11-… 2016-01-11     S6CA00808    DEM   N                Senate     
#> 2 2016-11-… 2016-01-08     P60019015    DEM   N                President  
#> 3 2009-02-… 2009-01-29     S4IL00180    DEM   C                Senate     
#> 4 2009-02-… 2009-01-29     S4IL00180    DEM   C                Senate     
#> 5 2002-04-… 1999-08-04     H0IL01087    DEM   P                House      
#> 6 2018-02-… 2015-09-26     P80003338    DEM   P                President  
#> # ... with 24 more variables: state <chr>, federal_funds_flag <lgl>,
#> #   has_raised_funds <lgl>, office <chr>, name <chr>,
#> #   district_number <int>, incumbent_challenge <chr>, party_full <chr>,

    Search for All Candidates of a Party in a State

    texas_republicans <- search_candidates(state = "VA", party = "REP", election_year = 2018)
#> Candidates found: 28
#> Total Principal Committees associated with these candidates: 27

head(texas_republicans)
#> # A tibble: 6 x 30
#>   load_date last_file_date candidate_id party candidate_status office_full
#>   <chr>     <chr>          <chr>        <chr> <chr>            <chr>

#> 2 2018-02-… 2017-11-27     H8VA06104    REP   C                House      
#> 3 2017-03-… 2017-03-10     H4VA10089    REP   C                House      
#> 4 2018-04-… 2018-02-20     H8VA06153    REP   C                House      
#> 5 2018-04-… 2018-02-09     S8VA00339    REP   C                Senate     
#> 6 2017-09-… 2017-01-01     H8VA11070    REP   C                House      
#> # ... with 24 more variables: state <chr>, federal_funds_flag <lgl>,
#> #   has_raised_funds <lgl>, office <chr>, name <chr>,

    Search for All Candidates Running for Senate

    senate_candidates <- search_candidates(election_year = 2018, office = "S", candidate_status = "C")
#> Candidates found: 173
#> There are 2 pages of results to get.
#> On page 2/2
#> Total Principal Committees associated with these candidates: 181

head(senate_candidates)
#> # A tibble: 6 x 30
#>   load_date last_file_date candidate_id party candidate_status office_full
#>   <chr>     <chr>          <chr>        <chr> <chr>            <chr>      
#> 1 2018-04-… 2017-04-11     S8AZ00122    DEM   C                Senate     
#> 2 2018-02-… 2017-09-21     S8OH00094    REP   C                Senate     
#> 3 2018-02-… 2017-06-09     S8PA00304    REP   C                Senate     
#> 4 2018-02-… 2012-11-14     S2MO00429    REP   C                Senate     
#> 5 2018-04-… 2018-01-10     S8AZ00247    REP   C                Senate     
#> 6 2018-02-… 2017-05-11     S8PA00296    REP   C                Senate     
#> # ... with 24 more variables: state <chr>, federal_funds_flag <lgl>,
#> #   has_raised_funds <lgl>, office <chr>, name <chr>,
